abstractText: One common application of otolith microchemistry is to determine where (spatially) adult fish originated from (i.e., where they were spawned) based on Sr 87/86 ratios present near the core of the fish's otolith. At the population-scale, it is valuable to know where the majority of fish originated from to help with guiding regulation setting, stream protection, stream restoration, etc. The piece of information can certainly help with prioritization.
title: Rainbow Trout stock contributions from otolith microchemistry v1.0
